comment:
Based on the information provided by your colleagues, it seems that the optimization problem has been correctly modeled and implemented using the Gurobi optimization library in Python. The decision variables, constraints, and objective function have been defined appropriately.

To maximize the repairman's earnings, the code calculates the optimal number of washing machines and freezers to fix based on the available inspection and fixing time constraints. The objective function to maximize earnings from fixing each appliance has been set up correctly.

You can run the `prob_215` function with the appropriate parameters to get the optimal objective value, which represents the maximum earnings the repairman can achieve by fixing the appliances.

If you have any specific questions or need further clarification on any part of the code or problem statement, feel free to ask.
